title: Controlling Asthma
content:
Breathing in
mold
can trigger an asthma attack whether or not you are allergic to mold. Indoors mold grows in damp areas such as kitchens, bathrooms, and basements, or where water damage has occurred.  Get rid of mold in your home to control your attacks. To reduce mold exposure in your home:
Dry damp or wet items within 24 to 48 hours to prevent mold growth.
Fix water leaks as soon as you can.
Replace ceiling tiles and carpet if they are moldy.
